# Game Maker: Flapping Fowl
## Intro

Today we're going to make a copy of the game "Flappy Bird", which took the world by storm in 2014.

The goal of the game is to push the buttons to keep the bird in the air as long as possible.

You lose if you hit the wall, floor, or any of the obstacles that come flying towards you.



## The board
As you can see, we've already started on the game for you. These two blocks should be left alone for now.


## Flapping Fowl 1
Let's add our hero, **Flapping Fowl**.

Click the ``||sprites: Sprites||``-menu and find a ``||sprites:set mySprite to||``-block. Click and drag it to the bottom of ``||loops:on start||``.


It's a good idea to give things proper names, so if you want to, you can click the square that says ``||variables: mySprite||`` and then Rename variable to rename it to something like ``||variables:flappingFowl||``.

PS! If you want to check that you're following the tutorial correctly, you can press the light bulb underneath this text box to see a hint.

```blocks
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    `, SpriteKind.Player)
```


## Flapping Fowl 2 - design
Let's draw our hero.

To open the drawing board, click the **gray square** next to ``||sprites: sprite||`` in the block you just added.

You can either draw your own figure, or click the "Gallery" at the top to choose from a collection of pre-made figures.



## Flapping Fowl 3 - Physics part 1
To make our hero fall, we need to add gravity to our game.

Find a ``||sprites: set mySprite x to 0.||`` and place it at the bottom of ``||loops: on start||`` 

PS! If you get an error message, remember to change from ``||variables: mySprite||`` to whatever you named your hero.

## Flapping Fowl 4 - Physics part 2
Click on X and change it to ``||sprites: ay (acceleration y)||``, then change the number from 0 to 300.

Do you know what "acceleration" means?



## Flapping Fowl 5 - Position
The game board is made up of a grid with 160 points ("Pixels") from left to right, and 120 points from top to bottom.

We want flappingFowl to start on the **left** side of the screen.

Find a  ``||sprites: set mySprite position to x 0 y 0||`` and place it at the bottom of  ``||loops: on start.||`` Click one of the numbers, and you'll get a crosshair to help you pick the spot you want.

Warning! Make sure you don't place your hero so far to the side that it collides with the border.

## Flapping Fowl 7 - Control 

Find a new ``||sprites: set mySprite x to 0||``-bock and place it in the ``||controller: on button press||``-block.

Change from ``||variables: mySprite||`` to what you named your hero ("flappingFowl")

Click the ``||sprites: x||`` and change it to ``||sprites: vy (velocity y)||``, and set the 0 to -100. 

Test your game and see what happens when you click the A-button on the screen (or the SPACEBAR og Z-button on your keyboard.)

```blocks
controller.A.onEvent(ControllerButtonEvent.Pressed, function () {
	flappingFowl.vy = -100
	flappingFowl.setPosition(20, 60)
})
```




## Rules - Game Over 1
Both our hero ``||variables: flappingFowl||``and the border around the screen (``||variables: border||``) are SPRITES, and we can make things happen when these overlap.

Find a ``||sprites: on sprite of kind player overlaps othersprite of kind player||``-block and place it somewhere outside of ``||loops: on start||``.

Click the right ``||sprites:Player||``-field and change it to ``||sprites: Enemy||``



```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Enemy, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
})
```


## Rules - Game Over 1
Find a ``||game: game over||``-block og place inside the block you just added.

What makes more sense to you? That you ``||loops: WIN||`` or ``||loops: LOSE||`` the game when you hit the wall?



```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Enemy, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
    game.gameOver()
})
```




## Rules - Points
To see how good we are at the game, we need some way to earn points.

Find a ``||game: on game update||``-block and place it somewhere outside the other blocks.

Inside this one, place a ``||info: change game score by 1||``.


```blocks
game.onUpdateInterval(500, function () {
    
    info.changeScoreBy(1)
})
```

## Obstacles 1 - Invisible cannon
Let's make the game more exciting!

In Flappy Bird, the bird had to carefully jump through a maze of pipes. We're going to add our own obstacles that will appear randomly from the side.

First we need to make an **invisible cannon** that fires obstacles.

Find a new ``||sprites: set mySprite to sprite of kind Player||``-block and place it at the bottom of ``||loops: on start||``.

Give this a new name instead of ``||variables: mySprite||``, something like ``||variables:cannon||`` or ``||variables:invisibleCannon||``

Change the type from ``||sprites:Player||`` to ``||sprites:Enemy||``.


Warning! It's best to **not** draw something in this Sprite.

## Obstacles 2 - projectiles
Find a ``||sprites: set projectile to projectile from mySprite with vx 50 vy 50||``-block and place it inside the ``||game: on game update||``-block from earlier.

Click ``||variables: mySprite||`` in this block and change it what you named your invisible cannon.

Then click the gray square to design your obstacles!

PS: You can make the obstacles taller or wider by changing the X and Y numbers at the bottom of the drawing screen.

```blocks
game.onUpdateInterval(500, function () {
    projectile = sprites.createProjectileFromSprite(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        `, invisibleCannon, 50, 50)
    info.changeScoreBy(1)
})
```


## Hindringer 3 - retning
Du kan bestemme fart og retning p prosjektilene ved  endre p **vx** og **vy**-verdiene i blokken. 
Begynn med f.eks. **vx -76** og **vy 0**, og prv deg frem med andre verdier til du finner en fart du liker. 

```blocks
game.onUpdateInterval(500, function () {
    projectile = sprites.createProjectileFromSprite(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        `, invisibleCannon, -76, 0)
    info.changeScoreBy(1)
})
```

## Obstacles 4- Teleporting cannon
Now it's time to make the obstacles appear from random spots.

Find a new ``||sprites: set mySprite position to x 0 y 0||``-block, and place it at the TOP of the ``||game: on game update||``-block. Change from ``||variables: mySprite||`` to what you named your cannon.

Set **x** to **160**. Find a ``||math: pick random 0 to 10||``-block and place in the **y**-field. Set it to go from **0** to **120**.




```blocks


game.onUpdateInterval(500, function () {
    invisibleCannon.setPosition(160, randint(0, 120))
    projectile = sprites.createProjectileFromSprite(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        `, invisibleCannon, -76, 0)
    info.changeScoreBy(1)
})

let invisibleCannon = sprites.create(img`
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
    `, SpriteKind.Enemy)


```



## Obstacles 5 - Easy or Hard?
We're almost finished! The last thing to do is to add rules for what should happen when the projectiles hit us.

Make a new ``||sprites: on sprite of kind player overlaps othersprite of kind player||``-block and place it somewhere there's room.

Change the **right** field from ``||sprites: Player||`` to ``||sprites:Projectile||``. 

Now you need to make a choice: Do you want the game to end as soon as you get hit, or do you want to lose lives each time until you run out?


```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Projectile, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
   
})
```


## Obstacles 6 - Hard Mode
It's very easy to make the game hard. All you need to do is to place a  ``||game: game over||``-block inside the block you just added.

If you want the game to be a little more easy, don't place this block and move on in the tutorial.

If you're happy with the game like this, you are DONE! Great work!

Skip ahead to the last step of the guide and enjoy your game!



```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Projectile, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
   game.gameOver(false)
})
```




## Obstacles 7 - Easy Mode 1
To not lose immediately when a projectile hits us, we need to tell the game to remove the projectile when it touches us. 

Place a ``||sprites: destroy mySprite||``-block in the overlap projectile block. Click on and drag the red ``||variables: otherSprite||``-circle out of the border, and place it **on top of** ``||variables: mySprite||``.

(This step is a little tricky to explain in words, feel free to ask the Guide to show you how)


```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Projectile, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
    sprites.destroy(otherSprite)
})
```

## Obstacles 8 - Easy Mode 2
Find a ``||info: change life by -1||`` block and place it under the destroy otherSprite-block.


```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Projectile, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
    sprites.destroy(otherSprite)
    info.changeLifeBy(-1)
})
```
## Finished!

Good job! The game is ready to be tested. How many points can you get?

Feel free to tweak the numbers and see if you prefer things like heavier gravity or faster projectiles.

When you press the DONE-button underneath, a window will pop up. From here you can upload your game to the Internet so you can share it with friends and family. Or even play it on your phone! (It should run on pretty much *anything* that has a web browser).

You'll also get access to all the functions in MakeCode Arcade that we've hidden from you, so that you can make your game even better!

What about adding new levels to the game? Or let a player 2 control the cannon?
